DataElement.preferredDefinition: An antibody is a type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A list of values for categories of antibodies.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An antibody is a type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An antibody is a type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

Concepts.definition: A type of protein made by B lymphocytes in response to a foreign substance (antigen). Each antibody only binds to a specific antigen, helping to destroy the antigen directly or by assisting white blood cells to destroy the antigen.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/21/11 Released caNanoLab v1.5 content per Sue Pan as part of model cleanup task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A list of values for categories of antibodies.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Part of an immunoglobulin antibody that binds a specific antigen and consists of both a light chain and part of a heavy chain.  By comparison, natural antibodies consist of two heavy and two light chains.  An FAB (fragment antibody) offers the advantages of smaller size and lower cross-reactivity compared to the complete antibody. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: Part of an immunoglobulin antibody that binds a specific antigen and consists of both a light chain and part of a heavy chain.  By comparison, natural antibodies consist of two heavy and two light chains.  An FAB (fragment antibody) offers the advantages of smaller size and lower cross-reactivity compared to the complete antibody. (NCI04)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetically engineered antibody consisting of both the variable heavy chain (VH) and the light chain (VL) of an immunoglobulin. These entities are joined together by a flexible peptide linker.

Concepts.definition: A genetically engineered antibody consisting of both the variable heavy chain (VH) and the light chain (VL) of an immunoglobulin. These entities are joined together by a flexible peptide linker.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 9/21/11 Released caNanoLab v1.5 content per Sue Pan as part of model cleanup task.
